main.name: CNN - Cat Dog with AlexNet
main.description: For this project, the famous Convolutional Neural Network model, AlexNet, was implemented to train a Cat Dog classifier. The model already came with pre-trained weights that were to be adjusted during the training of the new cat-dog images

overview.title: Dataset
overview.description1a: The dataset used consisted of 24,994 prelabelled photos, evenly split between dogs and cats. The dataset was taken from Kaggle's Dogs vs. Cats Dataset:

overview.title: AlexNet
overview.description1a: As stated above, AlexNet already came with pre-trained weights. However, AlexNet is built to have 1000 classification outputs. To implement it for Dog-Cat classification, the final output was reduced to 2.
overview.description1b: For more details of the implementation, as well as the layers used in AlexNet, please look at my code on Github:

overview.title: My CNN
overview.description1a: My CNN created using PyTorch was much simpler than AlexNet, containing a lot less layers.
overview.description1b: For more details, please look at my code on Github:
